direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods modify the buffer's position (read vs. write) and handle similar exception scenarios.
Both methods involve reading from the buffer but with different purposes (consuming data vs. copying data).
Both methods interact with the buffer's data but in different contexts (reading vs. writing).
Both methods involve reading operations but with different state changes (consuming vs. offset reading).
Both methods handle buffer overflow exceptions similarly but in different contexts (reading vs. writing).

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require buffer initialization before performing operations.
Reading data from the buffer is a prerequisite for consuming read data.
Both methods involve verifying buffer state and handling exceptions similarly.
